macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Major U.S. Indexes Post Modest Gains Amid AI Uncertainty
items.summary: The Nasdaq Composite, S&P 500, and Dow Jones Industrial Average each gained 0.1% as markets grapple with artificial intelligence concerns replacing tariff policy as the primary driver of volatility. The VIX volatility index remains elevated at 20.24, above its normal range.

items.title: AI Tool Launch Triggers Market Volatility in Wealth Management Sector
items.summary: A new AI tool claiming to automate wealth management work sent shockwaves through markets, causing significant declines in UK investment platforms with some names falling double digits. The development highlights market concerns about AI's impact on professional services.

items.title: Market Splits AI Trade Into Infrastructure vs. Application Layer
items.summary: Software stocks faced significant selling pressure while mega-cap AI infrastructure companies held steady, reflecting a market repricing of AI assumptions. The divergence signals investor skepticism about near-term returns from AI applications.

items.title: Housing Market Index Misses Expectations
items.summary: The NAHB Housing Market Index fell to 36 in February from 37 in January, missing consensus expectations for improvement and signaling continued weakness in the housing sector.

items.title: Nvidia Earnings Report Scheduled for February 25
items.summary: AI bellwether Nvidia is set to report fiscal 2026 fourth-quarter results on February 25, with markets closely watching the company's guidance amid broader AI sector uncertainty.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Price Eyes Crash as Consolidation Continues
items.summary: Bitcoin trading at 67,250, down significantly from October's all-time high of 126,400. Technical analysis shows bearish signals with the coin below key support levels and forming a bearish pennant pattern, with the next target at the year-to-date low of 60,000.

items.title: Bitcoin Forecast Lowered, Price Diverging From Gold
items.summary: Bitcoin forecasts have been lowered as the cryptocurrency shows divergence from gold price movements, indicating shifting market dynamics and investor sentiment.

items.title: SEC Approves DTC Tokenization of Stocks
items.summary: The SEC has given approval for the DTC to proceed with tokenizing stocks on blockchain, marking a significant regulatory development for asset tokenization in the financial industry.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Merck and Mayo Clinic Announce AI-Enabled Drug Discovery Collaboration
items.summary: Merck and Mayo Clinic have launched a research partnership integrating Mayo Clinic's clinical data and genomic datasets with Merck's AI and machine learning capabilities to accelerate drug discovery and development using AI-enabled virtual cell technologies.

items.title: AI-Powered Digital Pathology Tools Emerging for Personalized Cancer Treatment
items.summary: Companies like Valar Labs are developing machine learning algorithms that analyze tumor pathology to predict chemotherapy response and guide treatment recommendations, potentially advancing personalized oncology care.

items.title: SANS and siberX Launch NOW // AI Risk Management Simulation Program
items.summary: SANS Institute and siberX introduced NOW // AI, a simulation program designed to help organizations strengthen AI risk management, improve security governance, and align secure AI deployment with business outcomes.

items.title: Columbia University AI Administrator Raises Concerns About AI Hype vs. Reality
items.summary: Matthew Connelly, a vice dean for AI initiatives at Columbia University, expresses skepticism about AI capabilities, noting a significant gap between industry claims and actual performance in controlled settings, while raising concerns about data usage in university partnerships with tech companies.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 Confirmed for Game Pass on March 3rd
items.summary: Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 will arrive on Xbox Game Pass on March 3rd, 2026, as part of the February wave 2 Game Pass announcements. The game will be available through Play Anywhere.

items.title: PS6 Potentially Delayed Due to RAM Crisis
items.summary: Reports suggest that a RAM crisis could delay the PlayStation 6's release, according to recent gaming industry coverage.

items.title: Epic Games Acquires Meshcapade for Digital Human Technology
items.summary: Epic Games has acquired Meshcapade, a Max Planck spin-off specializing in AI-driven 3D human modeling and motion capture from video. The acquisition aims to improve digital character creation tools for gaming and film production.

items.title: Hasbro Shuts Down Atomic Arcade Studio
items.summary: Hasbro has closed its Atomic Arcade game development studio, though the company states its in-development G.I. Joe 'Snake Eyes' game remains active.

items.title: Rewind 99 Launches Free Steam Demo
items.summary: Rewind 99, a chaotic video rental store management game, released a free Steam demo ahead of Steam Next Fest.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Amazon Leads Global Tech Layoffs with 16,000 Job Cuts
items.summary: Amazon has accounted for over 52% of global tech job cuts in 2026, announcing 16,000 layoffs last month following 14,000 cuts in October, despite posting record $716.9 billion in revenue.

items.title: Legal Challenge to Qualcomm's Chip Licensing Model
items.summary: A legal challenge is mounting against Qualcomm's licensing playbook, potentially changing the economics of connected devices across phones, PCs, and emerging hardware categories.

items.title: Apple Tightens Global Launch Cadence with Lower-Cost Devices
items.summary: Apple is optimizing its hardware distribution strategy with multiple device refreshes, including lower-cost and mainstream hardware to broaden its installed base.

items.title: Semiconductor and Lighting Companies Announce Major Restructuring
items.summary: European semiconductor and lighting group ams Osram announced approximately 2,000 layoffs despite narrowing losses, as tech companies pivot toward automation and operational efficiency.
